title: Fans of Amy Winehouse are paying tribute on the anniversary of her breakthrough album
text:
(CNN) The late British singer Amy Winehouse released her last studio album, "Back to Black," on this day in 2006. Today, fans are honoring her memory on Twitter and celebrating the album that propelled her to international fame.

That soulful album won her five Grammy awards, including Best Pop Vocal Album and Best New Artist, while "Rehab," its leading single, spent 20 weeks on the US charts.

Winehouse's bold, melancholy music drew from '60s R&B and soul influences, a style that would help set the stage for female British soul singers like Adele and Lily Allen.

One fan tweeted, "I was just singing Back to Black yesterday. I miss her and her music everyday."

I was just singing back to Black yesterday. I miss her and her music everyday https://t.co/BqC59nFKwH — Lana ♉️ (@alannahscott) October 27, 2019

Winehouse was widely recognized by her signature thick-winged eyeliner and exaggerated black hair. Some fans are sharing photos of the singer's iconic look.
description: The late British singer Amy Winehouse released her last studio album, "Back to Black," on this day in 2006. Today, fans are honoring her memory and celebrating the album that propelled her to international fame.
